snippet: Supermarket workers in Berlin and Brandenburg State who were unpacking banana boxes found hundreds of pounds of cocaine, worth about $8.2 million, the police said Tuesday.
abstract: Supermarket employees in Berlin and Brandenburg State, Germany, uncover hundreds of pounds of cocaine, worth about $8.2 million, while unpacking boxes of bananas; authorities surmise that drug smugglers made logistical error.
lead_paragraph: Supermarket workers in Berlin and Brandenburg State who were unpacking banana boxes found hundreds of pounds of cocaine, worth about $8.2 million, the police said Tuesday.

headline.main: Germany: $8.2 Million in Drugs Found Among Fruit
